intro: Payena khoonmengiana, commonly known as the Khoonmengian payena, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with four petals. It is typically found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
